markdownRemark.html:
We shipped today Gatsby‚Äôs first beta for 1.0! Gatsby is a modern blazing-fast static site generator for React.js.

Ten months and one day ago I announced I was now working full-time on Gatsby followed a month later by posting an issue kickstarting the rewrite of Gatsby for a 1.0 release

Since then, 40 contributors have pushed 723 commits contributing to 23 alpha releases before today‚Äôs first beta release. It‚Äôs been a really enjoyable experience watching Gatsby v1 take form and helping shape that and the growing community around it.

What‚Äôs part of v1

From Gatsby‚Äôs initial release just over two years ago, Gatsby has let you build static websites using React.js components as well as markdown, JSON, and YAML.

Building on this strong foundation, v1 adds:

  • New plugin architecture (to date 45+ plugins have been written)
  • New data layer which lets you integrate data from both remote (CMSs, APIs, etc.) and local sources
  • Progressive web app features such as automatic code and data splitting (by route), prefetching, and service worker and offline-first support
